item.title: The future of deep tech will be explained to you at StrictlyVC Palo Alto on Dec 3
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: On Wednesday evening at PlayGround Global in Palo Alto, some very smart people who are building things you don't understand yet will explain what's coming. This is the final StrictlyVC event of 2025, and truly, the lineup is ridiculous.

item.title: Microreactor startup Antares raises $96M for land, sea, and space-based nuclear power
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Antares is designing and building small modular reactors that it plans to deploy for commercial, space, and defense applications.

item.title: The spectacle of Bryan Johnson and his livestreamed shrooms trip
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Bryan Johnson livestreamed his shrooms trip -- which included both Grimes and Marc Benioff -- as part of his controversial longevity research.

item.title: Android 16 adds AI notification summaries, new customization options, and more
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The rollout of the new Android 16 features, which are first coming to Pixel devices, marks a new chapter in how Android updates work, as the company is shifting from a single yearly update to more frequent releases.

item.title: Netflix launches a mobile-friendly version of Red Dead Redemption
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Players with a Netflix subscription can now download the game, which features mobile-friendly controls, including touch-screen shooting and navigation. It's important to note that the game does not feature a multiplayer mode and players must be connected to the internet to play; offline gameplay is not available.

item.title: ChatGPT referrals to retailers’ apps increased 28% year-over-year, says report
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: ChatGPT referrals to retailers' apps were up on Black Friday year-over-year, with Walmart and Amazon benefiting the most.

item.title: AWS launches new Nova AI models and a service that gives customers more control
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Amazon Web Services announced four new AI models within its Nova model family and a frontier model service.

item.title: OpenAI slammed for app suggestions that looked like ads
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: OpenAI clarified that the app suggestion was not an advertisement, but instead a poor attempt to integrate an app discovery feature within conversations.

item.title: Discord users can now buy in-game items without leaving the platform
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Discord users can now purchase digital game items directly within the platform, create wishlists, and send gifts through DMs.

item.title: YouTube releases its first-ever recap of videos you’ve watched
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: YouTube Recap features a set of up to 12 different cards that highlight a user's top channels, interests, the evolution of their viewing habits, and which personality type they fall into based on the videos they loved to watch.

item.title: A data breach at analytics giant Mixpanel leaves a lot of open questions
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: We sent over a dozen questions to Mixpanel's CEO about the company's data breach. Here's what we want to know.

item.title: AWS re:Invent 2025: How to watch and follow along live
item.dc:creator: Morgan Little
item.description: Amazon Web Services’ big annual event, re:Invent 2025, is getting into full swing in Las Vegas this week, and you can follow the keynotes live right here.

item.title: Amazon starts testing ‘ultra-fast’ 30-minute deliveries
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The new "ultra-fast" delivery option will allow Amazon to better compete with services like DoorDash, Uber Eats, and Instacart.

item.title: Simular’s AI agent wants to run your Mac, Windows PC for you
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Simular, a startup building AI agents for Mac OS and Windows, has solved the AI hallucination problem in a compelling way.

item.title: Amazon releases an impressive new AI chip and teases an Nvidia-friendly roadmap
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: AWS has been building its own AI chips — and systems — for years now. It just released its third version, known as Trainium3, with some impressive specs.

item.title: AWS announces new capabilities for its AI agent builder
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: AWS is introducing new capabilities for its AI agent-building platform, including memory and evaluation tools.

item.title: Mistral closes in on Big AI rivals with new open-weight frontier and small models
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Mistral unveils its Mistral 3 lineup, including a frontier model and efficient small models designed for offline, customizable enterprise use — aiming to prove small, fine-tuned AI can beat closed-source giants.

item.title: Titan OS raises $58 million from Highland Europe for its smart TV OS
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Titan OS aims to expand its independent TV operating system in Europe and Latin America.

item.title: Apple Music’s Replay 2025 is here
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: This year, Apple Music Replay includes even more listening habits, including the "Discovery" section, which highlights new artists users listened to, and "Loyalty," which spotlights artists that users have kept coming back to each year.

item.title: Amazon Music’s 2025 Delivered is now here to compete with Spotify Wrapped
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: With 2025 Delivered, users will see a recap of their listening trends, showcasing their top artists, favorite songs, and preferred genres, along with stats for audiobooks and podcasts.
